topic.title: GuiListControl and GuiSelectableListControl
topic.p: GuiListControl is the base class of all list controls. This control transforms items in a collection to UI object with a specified layout. When items are scrolled out of the control and becomes invisible, UI objects for them are disposed. Resources are not taken by invisible items.

topic.title: GuiListControl::EnsureItemVisible
topic.p: This function moves the scroll bar to ensure that the specified item is visible.

topic.title: Item Events
topic.p:
UI objects dynamically created for items, it is not easy to handling mouse events for items by events in compositions. GuiListControl redirects all such events to the list control itself:
ItemLeftButtonDown
ItemLeftButtonUp
ItemLeftButtonDoubleClick
ItemMiddleButtonDown
ItemMiddleButtonUp
ItemMiddleButtonDoubleClick
ItemRightButtonDown
ItemRightButtonUp
ItemRightButtonDoubleClick
ItemMouseMove
ItemMouseEnter
ItemMouseLeave
itemIndex is added to the second argument of handlers for these events starting at 0.
